message.div: Age can be specified using a combination of time units, similar to '5.3y 8d 22m' or in half lives like '2.5 HL'.

The age does not effect the activity of the entered nuclide, it only effects the amount of progeny in-growth (i.e. only alters progeny activities, not parent nuclide activity) - the activity you entered will always be used for the parent nuclide you entered, no matter the age.
Acceptable time units: year, yr, y, day, d, hrs, hour, h, minute, min, m, second, s, ms, microseconds, us, nanoseconds, ns, or you can specify time period by hh:mm:ss.
Half life units or time periods can not be mixed with other units.
When multiple time periods are specified, they are summed, e.x. '1y6months 3m' is interpreted as 18 months and 3 minutes.
